item.title: Hierarchical PQ for ANN Search
item.description: Background Approximate Nearest Neighbors (ANN) Search is a simple problem: given a vector query vector $q$, a set of database vectors $V$, and a metric $d$, find the $v\in V$ that minimize $d(q, v)$. The approximate part of this problem is that an algorithm is allowed to be wrong, and so in particular doesn’t need to test every $v\in V$, allowing for significant improvements in performance through the use of various search structures and compression techniques.
